dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the inky swell, a river of moonlight cuts a path t lonely fishing tug drifting with the tide. THE MERRY WIDO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light bulb waltzes with the sway of the boat. Three sha Irish fishermen unwind after dinner, playing cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eldest and scruffiest (the SKIPPER) reveals his hand young deckhand (GREG). Read 'em and weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing, the Skipper unspools himself from the cramped t as he and ROY, the bloated first-mate, clamber above deck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every bloody night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy and the Skipper check the hauled in nets, until ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SILENT ARC OF LIGHT SLICES ACROSS THE SKY.     It caree downwards in a furious trajectory and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!!   A mile off their port it collides with the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper watches the water.     Unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg leaps on deck brandishing a clutch of cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye cheated! There's five aces!    I counted 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper brushes past Greg, distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secure the lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg looks to Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so funny now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy plucks one of the five aces from Greg's hand and flip over. Its backing is red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from a different deck, ya muppet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks it to Greg's damp forehead and carries on as ordered. Greg turns the remaining aces over. They're blue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Shite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foam rises as bubbles crest violently. Closing in, the Me Widow casts its searchlight across the churning surf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper steers carefully, holding a radio mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven Point. Haven Point. Haven Point. This is Fishing tug Merry Widow. Call sign echo whiskey niner ait fife. Position five nautical miles west of Erin Island. Responding to unknown distress flare. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper pulls back on the throttle, sloshing to a sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps the sonar screen.     A hazy shadow engulfs the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely something ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy shines his flashlight over the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something in the water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Roy wheels overboard, yanked into the murky sea. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011           3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper drops the mic and rushes to the rail with Gre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy's glowing flashlight bobs in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred yards off on the opposite starboard side, far behind them, Roy surfaces SCREAMING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and the Skipper rush to the starboard rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy's gurgled, tortured cries mist in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper snaps into action.   Seconds count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lose him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg points, fixing Roy's position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper grabs a lifebuoy, lights it up and throws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy! Don't panic, mate.     Swim for the buoy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Roy, kick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy's head strains the surface, his arms flailing in agon spasms ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And then silence as he goes under.   The sound of wat sloshes and laps against the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper stares hopelessly at the water.      Greg's p hand trembles. He lowers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper shoves a lifejacket into Greg's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg does, fumbling. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper loads a flare gun and aims it overhead -- WHO The glowing red beacon graffities the starry sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Widow. Merry Widow. This is Coastguard Haven Point. Please respond. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radio a mayday! (off Greg's hesitation) Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg scrambles back to the helm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and snatches the radio mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday-Mayday-Mayday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Widow, uh, echo whiskey niner ait fife. Man overboard. Man overboard. Emergency assistance required. Position --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Skipper scans the glassy sea with a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROY?!   ROY?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subtly at first, the buoy's bight of rope twinges.    The Skipper sees it. His eyes narrow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- it jerks like a fishing line.    The Skipper grabs it reels it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Roy, mate. Fight.  UNDERWATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buoy's rope moves towards the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the trawler keels steeply.     Greg grips the fi for support as debris rains on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Received Mayday, Merry Widow. Emergency rescue team dispatched. How many aboard? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water laps over Greg's feet as the boat rights itself. surveys the flooded deck. The Skipper's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your position, Merry Widow, rescue chopper on its way. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg drops the mic and edges outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deck swims with water.      Greg holds his breath, li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skipper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The abandoned C.B. mic swings to and fro.        Almost p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Widow, how many aboard? Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg rounds the pilothouse, breathing heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly what looks like a weird, headless black snake fe its way towards his boots. Greg turns and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrambles to the stern amongst the nets and snatches a gutting-knife with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trapped against the rail, panting, he prays for help but

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- HE'S DRAGGED OVERBOARD.      His legs round in the air cascades into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just beyond the Merry Widow, he surfaces gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus.    Oh Jesus.   Oh Jes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the moonlight the isolated Merry Widow reposes mournfu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CIARГЃN O'SHEA lies face down on a sofa. His bed for the night. He gropes a dry bottle of whiskey as a mobile phon RINGS. He stirs awake. It's no surprise he looks like shite, but to be fair he's not bad looking after a wash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh ... Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone we'll meet later as SGT KENIFICK replies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (via speaker phone) O'Shea, I take it you've left already because if you haven't, you're late. That ferry gets in at nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea rises, eyes closed.       Mouth dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... On the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're in the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're driving while on the phone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the name of God, I don't b--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea hangs up and drops his whiskey bottle in a bin whe it CLATTERS with yesterday's bottle, and the day before's GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An isolated house at the foothills of a mountain.    A wh Garda patrol jeep leaves the scene and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- rambles along the sunny coast.   At the wheel, O'Shea very hungover, droopy eyed Garda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lush green hills and whitewashed bungalows, pastel beache and multi-coloured fishing boats. Enchanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colourful crowds of FAMILIES (TEENS, KIDS, PARENTS) file the MAINLAND FERRY as it lies moored in the harbour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARDA LISA NOLAN hustles through the masses dragging a trolley bag and passing a sign that reads:  OILEГЃN Г‰IRINN, CГ‰AD MГЌLE FГЃILTE Welcome to Erin Island

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa opens a map and wrestles with it in the wind.   Soon defeated, it blows out of her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She chases it as if running down a mugger but it lifts skyward and twirls haughtily in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly inching towards her, driving with all the panach an abandoned shopping trolley, comes O'Shea. Bleary-eyed hunched over, he drops his window before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howya. O'Shea, is it? CiarГЎn?     We spoke on the phone. I'm Garda Nolan, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She considers his bedraggled appearance.   He looks like wants to vomit on her. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. Just being polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are ya gettin' in or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the boot and gazes back at the road, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyres SPLASH and CRASH in the war against potholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep follows the mountain road ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wincing, O'Shea hugs the wheel feeling every agonising bu A locket of Lisa's slick ponytail comes undone. She quick yanks it back giving herself a face lift in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea belches under his breath and Lisa flinches.    She a packet of mints from her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a mint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea stares at them, then at her.    Barely reading the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah thanks, they give me heartburn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He belches again as they jostle over another pothole. Lis drops her window and her hair erupts in the sea breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Lisa arrive at the station.   Home from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the grassy dunes, DR JIM GLEESON walks his dog. Fo health practitioner, he just preaches. He flings a stick his eager collie and it gallops over a dune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Gleeson follows, rising over the hill and stops cold a sees across the strand: A POD OF PILOT WHALES LAY BEACHED GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SGT KENIFICK wipes a thumb along his desk. On the verge o retirement he looks more like tourist in his sunshine hol garb. He rises to greet O'Shea and Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garda Nolan, lovely to have you. O'Shea, you look like shite. Would you go way and shave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re. Kenifick's clothes) A bit eager aren't ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smooth crossing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoother than most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be great, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hands O'Shea a mug from her bag.    He regards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think of the place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gorgeous, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Tis indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And quiet as shite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenifick and Lisa glance at O'Shea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhm, what kind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011           10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Lisa consider each other.     Lines firmly dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it black, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenifick's mobile RINGS and he silences it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can have my desk while I'm gone. O'Shea will tell you, 'tis mostly administrative, processing permits and that sort. You might catch the odd bit of commotion every now and then but half the island's leaving for the show in Dungary so it'll be dead all weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we can find something to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea rolls his eyes and passes Lisa her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it and sits at her desk, feeling her surroundin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered to Kenifick) Is she really necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa carefully arranges her desk how she likes it.     Ne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're only gone two weeks.      I can handle two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could.     But you wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenifick's mobile PINGS.      He checks the text message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be late, I said.      What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His phone RINGS again. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming, I'm coming.    Right, I'm off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rightio. Reports and files in the top drawer, anything you need, O'Shea will be here to show you round. O'Shea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna miss your boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SlГЎn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenifick leaves. An uncomfortable silence fills the air l two strangers in an elevator. Lisa sips her coffee. Hates it. O'Shea slumps at his desk, throws his feet up and sig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kenifick barges back in and O'Shea falls over himself to straighten up, burning himself with his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't go far with no tickets.    See you in a fortnight. Be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches them and leaves. O'Shea recovers and notices Lisa stifling a smile. The office phone RINGS and O'Shea sluggishly reaches for it. But Lisa beats him to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garda Nolan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the dock PADDY BARRETT sorts his lobster traps.   All short is a parrot and a wooden leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His traps appear empty, some mangled, but before he can protest one of the oblong traps leaps. He watches it and like a magic trick it leaps again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squats down and gazes between the seaweed strewn cage. Nothing to be seen thanks to the seaweed. He prods it and lo, it shifts violently. Hopping mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy rises, wipes his frowning forehead with his cap and gestures to a fisherman packing ice crates on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TADHG MURPHY saunters over.    An alpha male in a beta bo GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011            1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy gently kicks the lobster trap, spurring it. On cue, haphazardly jumps across the wet dock. Tadhg snickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a biggun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a lobster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy shrugs.   Tadhg kneels down and peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLAT! A GEYSER OF GOO SPRAYS IN HIS FACE!        Tadhg s to his feet, spitting furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh ya bastard, Paddy!      Ya knew it was gonna do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.    On me life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg wipes away the slime with his sweater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eurgh, the smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, it's a feckin octopus or something, it's covered in seaweed. But 'tis no feckin' lobster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg stomps off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An octopus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy considers the lobster trap, eyes flashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa drives safely, under the limit.     A turning approa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I go...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011   13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea waits for the last second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns sharply, amusing O'Shea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're after the sarge's desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not. I'd some holidays saved that needed to be taken and this posting came up and I thought sure what harm, why not? Can't hurt with the review board, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea nods, sussing her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you stationed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dublin Central.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how's that working out for ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. We got drugs, muggings, murders and rapes. Always on the go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you can relax, there's none of that here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know. It's the quiet places where all the mad shit happens. Just open a paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea smirks out his window.   Lisa notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you haven't missed a day of work in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And should I be ashamed of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving at the beach, Lisa parks sharply sending O'Shea colliding with the dashboard. He recovers, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seatbelt.    It is the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Lisa get out of the parked jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Lisa trundle past some ONLOOKERS (folks we'll party with later) and head towards the whales. They ploug forward until they're upon Dr Gleeson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all me years, never seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa Nolan, doctor Jim Gleeson. Resident physician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hello, love. How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have any Aspirin on ya, would ya, Jim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've a few winegums? Would ya like a winegum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa moves deeper down the beach and O'Shea follows. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer it if you'd introduce me as Garda Nolan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no one minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa marches on, staggering awkwardly in the soft sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Lisa arrive by the whales and ADAM SMITH, Ph.D nods to O'Shea as they approach. Busy working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing in a pad) One second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa's eyes light up at Smith's dismissal of O'Shea. A kindred spirit. Once Smith's ready, he ignores O'Shea and removes a glove to shake Lisa's hand. So very English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea stares at her.   Typical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith's a marine psychologist or something, did I get that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It's marine ecology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea shrugs, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More fortunate really. I'm based here doing studies for the department of the marine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith hands O'Shea the tip of a tape measure. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold this, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea doesn't have a choice. Smith walks the length of t whales, stepping around Lisa and touching her as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how long are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wonderful. Wonderful.   Are you staying nearby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea interrupts, deliberately:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are they dead?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?   No, they're just sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith and Lisa share a smirk. O'Shea notices and lets the tape measure go, snapping back on Smith's fingers. Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Smith trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they're pilot whales. It happens with them from time to time but no one really knows why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa notes deep spider-vein gashes on the whales' bodies if they were whipped with a huge cat-o'-nine-tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are those marks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure. Possible scratches off the rocks while washing up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't beach themselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011            1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they died at sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them? At once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a strange one all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea considers the ocean before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A charming little shithole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy kicks open the bathroom door.   He plugs the bathtu lets the tap run, filling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuffles out and returns wearing a welders mask and dragging the lobster trap. He lifts the trap over the bat rim and drops it into the bath water where it BUBBLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes his mask and peers in at it.   What the feck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dilapidated mill, long since operational. A sign reads "KEEP OUT".   The jeep pulls up and O'Shea and Lisa step

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Daly, Cooney about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the rim of a demolished "pit" DALY points to a ramp. Years of labouring have turned Daly into one big freckle. O'Shea follows Daly's directions up a ramp towards the demolished frame of a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daly elbows his MATE, ogling Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that is one arresting woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DALY'S MATE WOLF-WHISTLES.    Appalled, Lisa whips out he notepad and pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, what's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Przemyslaw Wojciechowski.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa closes her pad.    Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carry on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pit DECLAN COONEY directs Daly.    Although it's n possible, Cooney appears pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, just stripping an oil tank. This place is a death trap sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've warned the kids to keep out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney walks along a horizontal ladder towards O'Shea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone and wandering, Lisa steps into the path of a JCB wi big mechanical claw but still gets splashed by chalky muc that stain her polished boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch where you're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney and O'Shea stroll down the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Kenifick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On holiday. Leaving me up the creek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?    What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind O'Shea the JCB Claw grabs some scrap from the "pit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, remember that favour you owe me? I'm looking for some boys to help move a few things off the beach. An hours work, tops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "BEACH CLOSED" signs jut out of the rain soaked sand as Cooney, Daly and some HELPERS winch the last of the whale onto a JCB DUMP TRUCK, working in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney gives Daly's Mate, behind the wheel of the truck, thumbs up and off he goes, engine rumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do, boys.    Pack it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daly wipes the rain from his face as the Helpers pack up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget the shovels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daly ventures towards the shoreline towards a pile of too as everyone else leaves the beach. He gathers the tools, then something catches his eye. He sweeps some sand off o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What in the name of...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daly rises, shocked by whatever it is he sees until -- BA A tentacle grabs onto Daly's foot and whips his weight ou from under him. He collides with the wet sand. Winded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney throws the ropes and tools into the car boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daly claws at the sand as he's dragged into the sea, yell

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELP!   HELP ME!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ocean consumes him his gurgled CRIES drown out whi in the sand his struggle is washed away without a trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney waves the other cars off, then sits in his car. switches on the RADIO and checks his watch. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney scans the shore and finds the mislaid tools. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney sits back at the wheel, one leg resting outside hi door, holding out for Daly's return as something moves in his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a second to spare Cooney pulls his foot inside, shuts door and drives off. But the car stalls, snagged on something. He steps out, kneels and gazes under the chass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAM! He's dragged under face first, feet thrashing. The c rocks, the RADIO serenading his demise and the AIRBAG DEP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea leans on the counter, a whiskey before him. Avuncu proprietor BRIAN MAHER watches from behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A PUB TV: the white helicopter of the Coastguard circl the Merry Widow boat. Footage taken earlier in the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over TV images) -- search and rescue was called off as a search and recover operation became priority. A telling sign that the missing fishermen are believed to have perished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa approaches the counter/reception and hands Brian a k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, do you have an iron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian moves to get it and Lisa spots O'Shea, throwing her Shoeless, she rises up on her toes. Gaining two inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNA MAHER eavesdrops while wiping the counter.   Una has face you could confide in, but shouldn't. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian hands Lisa the iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow's Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Well, I have a key so ... see you Monday then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off and Una moves in, wiping under O'Shea's dri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks flying there, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all right. A bit uptight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do talk to her.    I talked to her all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, ye're all the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah leave him off, Una.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to you. (to O'Shea; about Brian) Eight years I was waiting for him to get down on his knee. Have ya ever heard the like of it? My family thought I was mad wasting me time on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah feck them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah feck you, Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una shuffles off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you what though if I weren't, you know, I'd be up them stairs like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian feels Una's stare from across the bar.    He smiles her, placating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grinning to himself at the far end of the counter, Paddy fixes O'Shea's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Paddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you like to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea turns back to his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you would, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would! If you were to know what I know you'd want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, tell us then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy shuffles closer, all excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, between you and me, I caught meself a sea monster today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011   23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swear to God, may he strike me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya don't believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no liar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian snickers in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feck off, you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In me bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your bathtub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having a bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night, Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea downs his drink and saunters off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignorant gobshite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops, turns back) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.   Didn't open me mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called you a gobshite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see you, if this wasn't the only feckin' pub on this shittin' island I'd piss on it than sooner come in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.   You're barred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy thinks a moment, then cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah I'm joking, you know that.   One more, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea scoffs and leaves them, following the hallway upst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea removes a small hip flask from his pocket and drai it. Coughs. Composes himself and approaches ROOM #3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa regards her chalk-stained boots. She brushes some of the dirt off them, sighs and returns to ironing her unifo A KNOCK comes to her door and she opens it to find O'Shea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances down the hallway.   O'Shea looks too, confuse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on down for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have work tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter out here.   No one will know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not.    I'm sober as a judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea slumps against the door, reclining casually.   Or imagines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so? Say the alphabet backwards for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Zed ... Et cetera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're not driving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course not. I'm taking Johnny's horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to ride a horse while intoxicated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so?    The horse is sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing, and you're in charge here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I think we got off on the wrong foot today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea changes weight to his other leg and accidentally k over Lisa's side-table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It clatters to the floor, knocking her toiletries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps her pick them up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notices a 'Stress Ball') What's that? GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa grabs it off him, mortified as he rises with a headr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, that last drink's gone straight to me head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, other places too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea grins suggestively, reading her wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you get this drunk every night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just high days and holidays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea rests against the wall.       Eyes drooping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy crashes his bicycle into a fence and staggers in th gate, mumbling something about bastards and fences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy pours himself a drink of what looks like homemade potcheen. Still muttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD!    The bathroom door rattles.    He looks at it, wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door yawns opens and Paddy creeps in, wearing his wel mask. He gazes into the tub and removes his mask. There just as he left it is the lobster trap, but it's BROKEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy leans down and checks the trap as behind him reflec through the slimy residue of his bathroom cabinet's mirro something black and slithery crawls up the wall behind hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see it but Paddy doesn't until a HISS. Paddy turns and the GRABBER spits a barbed tongue and whips itself onto h face. Paddy slams against the bathroom mirror, as if leve by a punch. The mirror shatters, obscuring the scuffle. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy tears it off his face, gasping and flings it away. Blood seeps from a three point puncture wound on his neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dirty ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy stamps on it, whatever it is. Again and again, unti out of breath, he staggers from the bathroom. A moment la he returns with a standing lamp and continues beating it. Over and over and over until he's exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warm glow of light from within would attract every mo within a mile if it were a dry Summer's night, but it's n It's raining and it's attracting something far more sinis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRENE MURPHY, cocooned in a bathrobe and slippers, snatch pair of socks and a sweater off the floor. Muttering, she sniffs the sweater and recoils. It reeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a mission she marches through the open plan home passi Fisherman Tadhg gazing at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg, you're stinking. Would you get in the bath already, I can smell you from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm watching this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing at all today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene enters the kitchen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and dumps it in a wash basket for tomorrow's load --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANG against the window. Irene startles. She leans, han cupped around her eyes pressed up against the glass, star out into the darkness. Any second now she's going to be pulled through ... only not. She tightens her robe instea GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011     28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, 'tis blowing a gale out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said 'tis ... nothing. I don't know why we had to move here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing wrong with me Mam's house.  OMITTED  OMITTED  OMITTED  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg scoffs, channel hopping with the remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apart from your Mam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg flicks the TV channel onto a 'TREMORS'. (Alternativ 'FAIR CITY' is on.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD!    The door trembles with the weight of a knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! Cooney headbutts the door, his head flopping like a dolls, jaw slack, eyes shut. He's dead. With arms stretch above his head, weight supported by his intertwined wrist and feet barely touching ground, something is swinging hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD!    Tadhg rouses and clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene blow-dries her hair.     She pauses to listen. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011    29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD!    Tadhg glances disapprovingly at the clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peers through the door-window. Cooney seems drunk off ass dirty dancing with the letterbox. Hips swiveling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that bloody Declan Cooney and he's pissed as a fart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene throws her eyes up and rises, tying her dressing go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give that cowboy any money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll only piss it up the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney, you look like death.   What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney swings suggestively to Tadhg's open mouthed horror

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene joins Tadhg at the door. Suddenly Cooney collapses, crumpling like a pile of wet laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney?   Are you all right, mate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg steps over Cooney's broken twisted body. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Tadhg's pounced upon and whipped up out of sight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg!    Tadhg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene chases after him as roof tiles tumble down on her. HE'S GONE. She scurries inside and locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV flickers as the reception falters. Outside the win the satellite dish bounces onto the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irene backs through the bungalow, shaking. The violent SCUFFLE on the roof rattling the ceiling light-shade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?    Oh God. Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WEIRD, PITCHED ROAR takes Irene's breath away.    Whate snatched Tadhg sounds unnatural, huge and mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soot tumbles down the chimney drawing Irene's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs and kneels before the fireplace and receives a b of black soot to the face. She coughs and sputters and reaches up to close the chimney chute. Fumbling, whimperi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something descends towards her, gaining speed.   Irene gr blindly at the clasp ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes dart open. That's not the clasp! She SCREAMS and flies up the chute like a mouse sucked up a hoover. And a her CRIES die out all that's left in the open fireplace i pair of orphaned fluffy pink slippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa DINGS the reception bell.   Una stumbles to her call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. Sleep well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand, thanks. Do I have something to sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.   The big one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una grabs her bill and hands it to Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the weather looking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's a storm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Are the gulls flying low or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's on the telly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una gestures to the TV weather report. Lisa smiles.   Of course. She fishes out her credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're working with O'Shea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Temporarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a nice fella isn't he?    Quite a catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends what you're fishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una hands Lisa her receipt to sign and watches her writin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Single? (off Lisa's nod) So's O'Shea. Well, widowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Widowed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think he's here? Sure there's no want for him round this neck of the woods but I suppose he wanted the peace. Or his superiors thought he did. He doesn't say, God love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa smiles uncomfortably and hands her receipt to Una. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So will you be sticking to the same room all week? Because we have a few doubles. There's more room in those, you know yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una winks knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The single room is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure now? You never know if you want to stretch your legs later on. Give it a week and we'll be booked solid, so we will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hightails it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panned out on a rubber mattress you'd swear O'Shea was de if he wasn't SNORING like a Granddad.
