dialogues.text: WHIPAH! A barbed tongue shoots out from the darkness of t cave and lances O'Shea's Garda hat clean off his head. O'Shea blinks, feeling his bare head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THUNDER-CRACK from the ominous rain clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leg it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy steps out of the way of an oncoming wave and kicks something with his heel. He kneels down and finds an EGG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs piled high like a fun fare ball pit. He barely has t to process this as O'Shea and Lisa come bounding towards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eggs are buried on the beach! There's feckin' loads of 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy regards the egg then takes off after O'Shea and Lis And in the gouged out sand beneath their feet more expose EGGS flutter with life. These things are close to hatchin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea, Lisa and Paddy stumble in, making a beeline for t Grabber female on the table. Smith looks up from his lapt to see O'Shea who has a petrol can and a plan in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, you're back. I have a theory! Those whales were killed as a food source for their spawn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eggs are buried at the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everywhere that's been, the other one's followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found another one?     Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tried to eat us! And it's HUGE and looking for her ... but this will be the last place it looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours petrol all over it.    Lisa hands him the lighte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad? Don't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa takes a fire extinguisher off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, stop, you'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith, it's for the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you muppet! If he lights that in here you'll--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea drops the lighter and BOOM!    It flashes up in fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! The sprinklers blast to life and water rains down them, the lab and the dormant amphibious bloodsucking ali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- get it wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really are Irish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa drops the fire extinguisher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya later, lads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy scampers out as O'Shea, Lisa and Smith scramble for mains under the sink. Six hands fighting to shut it off. Once they do, every surface drips. A fish-tank overflows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rise slowly from the slick floor. It's eerily quiet. Smith picks up a stool. Lisa grabs a scalpel. O'Shea roll up a magazine. They creep forward. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful. Once it's wet I don't know what it can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea edges closer.    It's unscathed from the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! It launches to life, sprays O'Shea with goo and div onto him, wrapping around his face, head and neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Smith leap to his aid and battle what looks like dozen boa constrictors working as one, choking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea flails and smashes into lab units, knocking a util closet open. Brooms and mops fall out as O'Shea slumps on the wet floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Smith pull tentacles loose and O'Shea gasps for His drained, ashen skin pocked with bleeding bite wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith flings the limp Grabber across the lab and it hits wet floor, flopping woozily and vomiting blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It bears down on its tentacles and springs itself onto th ceiling like an octopus shot out of an air cannon. SPLAT! It hits the fluorescent light and hangs from it, upside d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith blinks, agog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, it's an alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea feels his wounds. Furious, he grabs one of the mop surrounding him and jabs at the Grabber with the handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You vicious little fu--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grabber bites down on the handle and hangs on. O'Shea suddenly takes the full weight of it. It totters above th heads, swaying. Lisa and Smith duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!    Jesus! O'Shea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea drops it onto the floor and Lisa yanks a steel cab over, pinning it down. Trapped, the Grabber thrashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You can't! It's the scientific discovery of our time, imagine all that we could learn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabinet flips,   exposing the Grabber. Smith SCREAMS brains it with his   stool. Scared shitless, O'Shea and L pile in with their   boots. All three whacking and stampi until they're sure   it's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweating and in shock, they catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea flicks the Grabber goop out of his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll never make it across the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If those eggs hatch, with no whales to eat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- they'll head in land to feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finishing each other's sentences now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're hatching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio turn to notice Paddy has joined them looking dow the smooshed Grabber. O'Shea considers Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took three of us to get that thing off me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woulda helped but I've a bad back, gives me shocking pain, you know yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you still alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diet and exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, when that thing attacked you. You should be laid out in a box right now, but you're not. What makes you so special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was always lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea disregards him and takes a swig of his flask as Li considers the bloody sick. Queasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustn't have liked your blood much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea stills, hearing that question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were drunk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm clouds gather over the idyllic drinking hole as gal jeer and waves pile on the pub's neighbouring harbour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Gleeson peers at the Grabber's severed head in a beake gawping away like a fish head. He squirms. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's a cryptozoological amphibious sanguivore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dr Gleeson) Not a tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Gleeson removes his glasses to stare at O'Shea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you getting all these heads?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea leads the group leaving Dr Gleeson to add --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place has gone to the dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea, Lisa, Dr Gleeson, Smith and Paddy head for the pu O'Shea's setting the pace leaving Paddy hustling to keep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like leeches, right? They feed off your blood. Well when one of them bit Paddy, it almost died, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down for fuck sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Paddy was so intoxicated his blood-alcohol level was toxic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. If we taint our blood with booze, we're poisonous to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dr Gleeson) And you told me to cut back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Gleeson shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have just one night where we have to deal with this on our own. Tomorrow, we'll be sorted. We'll get off the island, they'll nuke the beaches or whatever they do, but all we have to worry about is tonight. And it's simple. We have a lock-in. We stay out of the rain and we drink. (turns to face them) We can't stop them coming but we can be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea backs into the pub. Lisa, Smith, Paddy and Dr Glee look at each other -- wow -- and follow him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian stares, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hostile migra --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Grabbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are ye for real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we for real?    Are YOU for real? Show him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith plops a beaker covered with a tea cosy on the count He raises it just a tad to show Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That? Sure you could kill that with a hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just the tip of the blood sucking iceberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian considers the four of them; all look gravely seriou GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give up.     Yes, a Grabber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith covers the beaker again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if its allergic to booze can't we just hose 'em with vodka or some shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because alcohol is a poison. It needs to be ingested to take affect. Also to preserve specimens I keep them in an alcohol based solution. Just like with this one, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith taps the tea cosy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's filled with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you drink it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what if we sprayed whiskey in its mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feck that.     A waste of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to get that close to it, good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una passes with a washing basket.    She stops, seeing th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011   57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just discussing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you're plotting something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.    More like planning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. (thinks, smiles) Carry on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. It's her birthday next week now she thinks this is something for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in for a shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea, Lisa, Smith, Brian and Dr Gleeson huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, the only people that know about this are us and it's gotta stay that way or we'll have a panic on our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group confer, sharing glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How drunk are we talking here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy levels of drunkenness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gone off your game, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offence but I don't think my body can handle Paddy levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes years of practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011      58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If those things do come for us, we'd be lambs to the slaughter if bombed out of our brains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with everyone hammered there's no one in a fit state to call the shots. The non-alcoholic shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but single someone out and they'll be sought as the only meat on the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what's to keep us safe from ourselves, forget what's outside, we could fall over and break our necks trying to conga. Statistics prove put a large number of people in a confined space, ply them with booze and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- you've got a hooley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what it said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will work. And I'll keep order. I won't be drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa almost steps back to take a closer look of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?   We'll both do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would put you both at risk.    I suggest it's just O'Shea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one of us need risk it and I know these people and this island better than you. It should be me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa ushers O'Shea aside (leaving the others talking amon themselves).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see what you're doing here but have you forgotten you're a dependent alcoholic organising a piss up in a brewery! I'll do it. It'll be easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, I'm good to no one when I drink. I know that. So do you.     I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna rain any minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks at him, holding his stare.   O'Shea doesn't fl FINALLY --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. But just so you know, I don't drink. I've never even been drunk. I don't know if I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you can. And you'll be the best drunken Guard this country's ever seen. You'll probably get promoted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea smiles encouragingly. He takes out his flask and hands it to her. Suddenly he seems taller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, if we're doing this we'll need a blood test from a healthy subject. Lisa, you're the fittest person here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You charmer. It's true, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, I want a table of everything Paddy had last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What night was last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011           60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you gotta be joking me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it was a big one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comin' right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table has six empties on it. Lisa sees double that though as she grips her seat for balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never liked me as much as her. She was the talented one, Daddy's little girl. That bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea holds her beer hand steady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.   Three fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I got you guys.    I love you all. Even you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's langers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She downs the dregs and breathes deeply through her nose while stroking her hair as only drunk women do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, that's everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, Dr Gleeson and Smith don't know if they should cla Paddy reaches into his pocket sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also had a snifter of ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small bottle of what looks like water.      O'Shea star knowing the answer before he asks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little home brew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring potcheen into my bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird never flew on one wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this is over we need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah come off it, this could save all our lives yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy pours a drop for Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ya go, pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian takes the bottle of potcheen from Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will in me shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa downs the potcheen and rests her head on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr Gleeson draws blood from Lisa. O'Shea, Brian and Paddy watch. Smith marks up a petri dish with his blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith places his petri dish of blood next to a cage and - WHIPAH! A tongue shoots out and hoovers up all the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's shocked.   Paddy almost chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the tainted blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're right, this will kill it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea presents Lisa's petri dish of blood and WHIPAH -- hoovers it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group leans in expectantly and BLEURGH! The Grabber projectile vomits up all the blood, startling and revolti them -- Ugh! And then it warps, withers and shrivels. Dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea holds the breathalyser in Lisa's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, now we know what we gotta do. Keep our blood alcohol levels at point two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group's horrified, except for Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You unnatural eejit. You're what'll kill us. Point two?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we going to determine that based on each person's body mass index?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're looking at up to ten pints each depending on height and weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to do shots. Properly tear the arse out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So lets do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to pay for all this by the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patrol jeep parks at the chapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, O'Shea and Lisa make their way towards the chapel doors.  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FR POTTS, an incredulous elder statesman, finishes mass. eclectic congregation of forty or so ISLANDERS bless themselves -- FISHERMEN, HOUSEWIVES, OAPs, Una, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mass has ended, go in peace to love and serve the Lord. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea, Brian and Lisa enter the back of the chapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Fr Potts last mass, so everyone that didn't leave yesterday for the thing in Dungary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Lisa walk up the aisle towards Fr Potts as peo rise to leave, some chatting to each other as they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, do you mind if I say a few words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea takes to the pulpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have your attention please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The congregation looks up, considering O'Shea.   MAMIE, a haired granny, tuts to her neighbour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, just a quick announcement, at Maher's Tavern tonight we're having a bit of a shindig and you're all coming to join us for what will be a great night's craic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wall of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're throwing a party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs a reason to have a laugh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa gestures to O'Shea, still drunk but she'll field thi one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a welcome party for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa seems very proud of herself for coming up with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A welcome party? But you're leaving in a fortnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's a goodbye party.    Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we mean to say is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FISHERMAN rises to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hey bucko! Where are you going? This party's for your benefit. And all of you are gonna be there too. It's the law!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I swear to God I'll arrest any one of you who isn't. Chalk it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa glares at the congregation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coddin' us, love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wilts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Garda Nolan means is we'd love your company. There's no point going home to a cold, empty house in weather like tonight when we'll be right across the street from here and we'll have music and craic and company -- and a FREE BAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HILDA, a stout woman, grabs her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the spirit! So c'mon, it's a party and the drinks are on us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JUKEBOX bellows with The Dubliners "Whiskey in the Ja Brian wades through the forty strong patrons. The drink's flowing, the merriment's joyous, ignorance is bliss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea, Lisa, Paddy, Smith and Dr Gleeson are gathered ov table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons.   What have we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa fumbles some skillets, knives and bats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a nail-gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWACK!   He nails a board of wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a board with a nail in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea nods.   OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a hurley and a pellet gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do with a pellet gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot pellets. But I don't have any pellets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, well you can just wave it at them then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, what have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a flare gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's impressed, except Paddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dibs the flare gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian slams a huge colourful Super-soaker before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.P.S. forty-one hundred pump action twin jet Super Soaker. Shoots twenty feet. The nephew's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A water pistol? This thing likes the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a water pistol if you use water. Fill it with petrol and you've got a flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dibs the water pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, well look sharp. You know your stations: guard each exit and don't let anyone out. Bottoms up.

dialogues.text: They each raise shot glasses and knock them back.   Lisa her salted wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tequila!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sucks the lime slice and everyone disperses. Alone, O'Shea considers the back window as the first drops of ra pelt against it. The MUSIC builds. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lapped by the surf, the detritus of egg spawns litter the shore as streams of track marks trail inland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain begins to fall, hard and fast.   No turning back now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC belts out of the Jukebox as folks get flutered. (Something with "rain" in its title.)

dialogues.text: Dr Gleeson guards the back entrance with his nail gun, watching the rain through a gap in the side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian tends bar, pouring shots. One for you, one for me. Mamie from the chapel leans on the counter, pisht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two shandies, Brian pet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the heart, Mamie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tip top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank Christ for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He palms them to her, guilty as sin. She sips one and coughs, teary eyed. The wind knocked out of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.text: She staggers off.

dialogues.text: Smith sips his vodka coke, watching the back door and standing by with the walkie talkie.

dialogues.text: Paddy sips his pint by the front door while Una dances wi Hilda, Mamie and others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and Lisa sit on stakeout outside the pub, rain pel against the windscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doubles up, laughing.     O'Shea fights off a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere. Listen. Listen. At the end of the day, you know? I dunno. I'm so into you right now. Joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches his reaction and stifles a burp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much have you had?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough to fancy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then keep drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea puts the breathalyser in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, is it? You think I think I fancy you. That's the sitchuashun we got, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I do. So whatcha wanna do 'bout it? Arrest me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles coyly.   Or tries to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know as flattering as it is to hear a beautiful drunk slurring her feelings for me, now's not the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa scoffs, then something (slightly) sobers her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you drink so much, CiarГЎn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the craic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right, and I work everyday 'cause I'm driven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hears herself aloud.    The admission sinks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always chasing them goals, you know? Always chasing. Always running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea considers her, recognising her vulnerability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too hard on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa wells up, the drink making her emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like I've known you for years. I don't know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe because I put years onto people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah.    That's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gaze at each other until O'Shea looks away first. hiccups. As ladylike as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your wife, O'Shea. I really am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una told me, how she died.    I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Una said what?   Of all the stories. Una is the biggest gossip going. You shouldn't listen to her. No one died. We just ... we didn't work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.    Ah shite, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Did you split because ... because of your alcoholickissness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't drink back then. No, she met someone else. It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea hides it well but this hurts.    Lisa notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feck her, O'Shea. If you want I'll find her and do her in for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea smiles.   Lisa reciprocates drunkenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast. From an alcoholic to a workaholic. (raises his coffee) To getting out of this alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment shared and then... GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm, toast.

dialogues.text: Patrol to Base. Patrol to Base. Come in, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.   Keep it up. Over.

dialogues.text: Smith goes to finish his vodka coke but it's already empt He goes to make another but then notices Paddy's potcheen bottle sitting idle on the counter. He considers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncorks it. Sniffs it. Pours himself a drop. Tastes it. Hmm, likes it. And pours himself a lethal dose of it, smiling away to himself. Sure God love him, he's fucked.

dialogues.text: I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limbless bouncing piranhas. They move clumsily, regularly toppling over as they hop, leap and jump. They're not ver intelligent or agile but they're inquisitive. And starvin

dialogues.text: Whoa, feck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ Almighty, me head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Una.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Shite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get us out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: We're gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your foot on the clutch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am arresting you for the murder of Doctor Gleeson. You are not obliged to say anything unless you wish to do so, but whatever you say will be taken down in writing and may be given in evidence.

dialogues.text: Base to Patrol. O'Shea we're running short here. We're dry on four taps and out of spirits and wines. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Brian, forget that help us barricade the door.

dialogues.text: What's goin' on?

dialogues.text: Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand.

dialogues.text: No!    NO!

dialogues.text: I was just gettin' a taste for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang talk over the din. The Islanders still blissfull unaware of what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment O'Shea's lost in his own world as he notices he's absentmindedly clutching a pint from the counter. He considers it, then pushes it away, grabs a chair and rise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, listen carefully. We're moving this party upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah now, what kind of party is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a precaution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A precaution to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea thinks.   Mamie rises with her coat. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm goin' home. I'm pisht.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits back down again, losing her balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.     No one can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People look, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone better tell us what's really going on here? Right now!  OMITTED  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panic and confusion spreads through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This party isn't for me, is it, Brian?! You lied to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see you! This is your fault. You brought that thing on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith hangs onto the pub wall, edging towards the front d as everyone's attention is focused on the commotion insid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are these my sausages?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah relax. You'll give yourself angina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give ya angina.    Outside, now! I claim ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!   You can't go outside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fr Potts et al) Because of the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa winks sleepily at the huddled masses as O'Shea gets between Brian and Paddy, separating them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon then, put 'em up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right you are! I'm sick of your bollocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian rolls up his sleeves.   Paddy takes out his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy! Brian! Cop on, I'm asking ya! Now's not the time for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy and Brian drunkenly box (by missing every punch, an falling over a lot). Una repeatedly punches Brian's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop fightin! Stop fightin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fr Potts holds onto the huddled and terrified Islanders. Lisa looks them all in the eyes, swaying and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we have it all under control. There's nothing trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith opens the front door, letting a chilling breeze int the pub. Everyone turns to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need more alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011      83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith staggers out the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks be to Jesus, let me out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea runs to the door holding people back from trying t follow. Folks jostle to see out windows and over shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! Smith, what are you doing? Smith!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith staggers out into the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea, Lisa and Paddy hang at the door, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith, listen to me. It's bigger than you think. Get back inside now! Please, I'm begging you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a picture with it. For National Geographic. And Facebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feck your photos, change the kegs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He's flutered, sure he'll be fine. G'wan, Smith! Fine fella y'are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROWL in the darkness. A hint of movement in the blacke shadows. O'Shea pales. Smith raises his digital camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith, mate! Listen to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! He snaps a photo and The Grabber lights up for a split second, ten feet from Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush, you'll scare it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT SMITH with THE PUB. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Grabber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!   Eight feet away from Smith.       And moving slo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!   Five feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH!   Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASH! The Grabber breaths on Smith, the air misting as i black lips unfurl back, revealing its pink bladed throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady. You don't want to eat me. I'm ripped to the tits!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tentacles molest Smith, writhing all over him, mussing hi hair. Licking and tasting his sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sticky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grabber recoils, having tasted his sweat.       Yuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to others, grins) See! I told you. It's just an animal, it doesn't want to hur--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- OOF! The Grabber flicks Smith out its way like a peanu sending him shooting off into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks SCREAM and whimper.       Complete shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flew?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grabber charges straight for them.       O'Shea slams and turns, back flush against it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, upstairs!      Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pub door collapses and JUMPERS flood in, breaching th fort. No doubt about it now, they're on a sinking ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stampede for the stairs. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Islanders clamber into the corridor, petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea pulls a cabinet over, leaving obstacles in his wak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea and some others push furniture down the stairs, blocking access with a fortified wall of rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The upstairs hallway is jammed as Brian opens a door into OLD DISUSED UPSTAIRS PUB, allowing people to filter in. T ruckus below sounding like a bar brawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone, stay calm.    They can't get up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what in the name of fuck were those things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD! CRASH! BANG! Islanders whimper.      O'Shea moves through the hallway, through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone been bitten? (no one has) You haven't been bitten because of the alcohol you've been drinking. They're allergic to drunk people. So there's no need to panic, we're safe up here. Has anyone got a mobile on them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone takes out a phone, some take out two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the mainland. Call the Coastguard. Call whoever you can get through to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start dialling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, is it the apocalypse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea catches his breath, hunched against the corner. He looks up to Una, Brian, Lisa and Paddy watching him. He forces the best smile he can muster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grabber retreats into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian opens the door to a supply closet. O'Shea and Lisa flank him. The closet's full of innocuous cleaning produc blankets, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just linen and cleaning stuff. Nothing we can really use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't ya just shoot it?     Ye guys must have some guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian closes the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the Gardai. Not the LAPD. (off their faces) An Garda Siochana will succeed not by force of arms or numbers, but on their moral authority as servants of the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa gasps. She grins at him with drunken pride.    O'She almost blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're bolloxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian shuts the door. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011       87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea watches the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's not right.   It can't be that hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eavesdropping, Paddy chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the female. It's following her scent. Sure didn't she slime you in the lab? Like with me bathroom and Tadhg Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tadhg Murphy's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some hallway people whimper, overhearing O'Shea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Tadhg Murphy's fine. He's at the festival on the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so's his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Islanders gasp.    Irene's dead too?!     Ah fuck.  OMITTED  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD!    A dead sheep slams the door (as Cooney did).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian peeks out the bedroom window.     Brian rounds the back towards O'Shea et al ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's swinging one of Tommy Riordan's sheep at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy, Lisa, Una and O'Shea look.     THUD!   THUD! GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011      88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cat does that, then leaves it on the doorstep as a present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mating ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll try to mount you, somehow. Failing that it'll most likely rip you limb from limb in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand.   Ah sure what can ya do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play hard to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUD!    The Grabber ROARS and slithers off into the shad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.     What does it want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea looks at the scared Islanders. He's what it wants. The sound of WINDOWS SHATTERING. Islander's whimper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna stop, is it? We won't survive the night. We're on a sinking ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian breathalyses himself sorrowfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too drunk to drive a car but not drunk enough. We're sobering up. All of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea nods tensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian consoles Una as another loud THUD shakes the floor the ceiling light shade above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't just sit here. It'll bring the walls down around us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011   89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we threw a bomb at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got semtex on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on me, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we like push it off a cliff or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or electrocute it?   I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vote we feed it Father Potts. Unless it eats shit it'll choke to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fr Potts perks up from the darker corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feck, is he in here? I was joking, Father. I apologise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fr Potts disregards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can't destroy it, what can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fr Potts) What about the phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fr Potts shakes his head.   Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, we know it does two things: it drinks blood and it breathes water. We took away one, we could take away the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to keep it away from water. Dry it out somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re. the rain) Look outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be some way we can stop it, fight fire with fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa notices her police boots from the day before, seeing chalky stains all along them. An idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grabber! Not the Grabber- Grabber, the mechanical one! (off their confusion) The big yoke, with the arm and the thing and you know? That big aul whatchamacallit you crush things with. The feckin' thing at Cooney's site! What's it called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Grabber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! With that thing you could grab it, hoist it up and trap it. It's raining now but it has to stop some time right? And when it does it'd be stuck. Once the sun comes up it'd cook. That'd dry it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea's eyes brighten, he smiles at Lisa.    She smiles properly proud of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can catch that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure 'tis lepping about all over the shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd need some sort of...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea clenches the leprechaun key-ring in his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A death trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011        91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea moves to a window to clock a white PICKUP TRUCK pa outside in the rain. His purposeful stride instilling confidence in the others. O'Shea's back in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got the keys to your truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian checks his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd be in the kitchen.     On the table, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go downstairs, those things will tear you to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might not get past them, but someone else could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be talking about the drunkest person we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes fall on Lisa as she licks her dry mouth.   Off t LOOKS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not, it's too risky. Paddy you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Feck off!   Brian should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian considers it.   Una's having none of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011            9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises, swaying) Slow down there. I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   It's too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is exactly why you'll want the best drunken guard this country's ever seen. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks at him, holding his stare.     O'Shea smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang rally around Lisa at the stairway blockade. hands her the nail-gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you get in trouble.      Pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes it in her hands, drunkenly marveling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, savage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the trigger and a nail stabs the wall inches fr Paddy's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy throws Brian a withering look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get the keys and come right back. I'll do the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fr Potts blesses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.    Just the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull away debris, allowing a gap. Lisa and O'Shea's gaze holds a second longer than necessary. Lisa smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa scrambles through.    Una steals a glimpse downstair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what they've done to the carpets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian consoles Una as O'Shea and Paddy seal the gap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Lisa TRIPS and slips down some stairs. Waking th dead. O'Shea, Brian, Una and Paddy gasp, listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa picks herself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S OK!   I'M ALL RIGHT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush!!    Keep your voice down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a goner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea looks at Paddy, then at Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you gonna get to the truck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run very fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love, you're not that fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need a decoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. If its you it wants, then we give it what it wants. We fashion a dummy, dress it up like bait and confuse the shite out of it. It won't know where to look when there's two of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how the hell do we make a dummy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea looks at Paddy, he likes that idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Improvise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011          94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumpers mill about, tearing the place asunder. One studie itself in a mirror, until it can't stand itself any more. attacks the mirror and knocks itself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another chokes while trying to eat a pool ball.   Lisa ro a corner, slumping lazily against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath and moves in amongst them. She sidesteps over one and dips her hand into a peanut bowl. She palms them into her mouth, chews and scans the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Jumper leaps onto the counter beside her. POP! It collapses back. Another Jumper climbs onto her foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks her leg and the Jumper flies off and smacks int the JUKEBOX, turning it on. Mundy's "Galway Girl" blasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian, Una, Fr Potts, O'Shea and Paddy grab supplies. A m a broom, a coat rack, marigold gloves, twine. The MUSIC BLEEDS UPSTAIRS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love that song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is she doing at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin assembling something as O'Shea masks his conce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry.  OMITTED  OMITTED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa searches for the keys. She scans the floor, finding full bottle of potcheen Smith drank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tucks it in her jacket pocket and continues searching behind her the back door slowly opens; its lock broken. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011         95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tentacles reach inside, snaking silently towards her as s finds Smith's Zippo lighter and holds onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots the keys under a stove and reaches, straining. face flush with the floor as the tentacles close in. Sudd a stray tentacle knocks a dangling skillet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CLANG! Lisa spins and fires the nail gun as tentacles rush towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hail of nails stab the wall and BLOW OUT the wall mount fuse box -- BANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sudden DARKNESS is met with SCREAMS!  MAHER'S PUB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa dives into the main bar and flips the Zippo lighter the Grabber seizes her leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lighter falls beyond reach and takes fuel off the coa rack. Flames crawl high upon the jackets and coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UH FIRE!   FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grabber drags Lisa across the pub floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy, Brian and O'Shea slot the mop into the coat rack a slide a broom through the horizontal gap, its clear now they're building a scarecrow. O'Shea puts his jacket over it, dressing it. Una sniffs the air in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you smell smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa grabs hold of the bar counter foot rail, but she's quickly pulled from it and slides into the  PUB KITCHEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: towards the gaping jaws that fill the backyard door frame She grabs broken bottles off the floor and stabs at the tentacle, glassing them. She grabs Dr Gleeson's board wit nail in it and slams it home. It uncoils around her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free, she runs for the pub front door. GRABBERS - Production Draft (GOLD) 28/1/2011           96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea frantically pulls apart the blockade as smoke funn up towards them. People panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going up in flames!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need those keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't wait, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Shea opens the hallway window and climbs out.   He nods towards Brian awaiting his cue: do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian flings the window open towards the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoohoo! Come and get me, you rotten bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paddy, Fr Potts, Brian and Una pick up O'Shea's scarecrow decoy and chuck it out the window into the back yard. Bri shuts the window and SPLAT-BANG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone jumps back!   Startled as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Grabbers's mouth fills the window, kissing glass. crawls upwards, smudging the window. Folks stare, horrifi

dialogues.text: On that -- A ROAR! They turn and see the Grabber staring them from across camp. It stalks forward like a cat approaching its prey. O'Shea and Lisa back up, keeping th distance. No sudden movements.

dialogues.text: CiarГЎn.

dialogues.text: No longer raining, O'Shea and Lisa look absolutely filthy they come walking over the hillside. She hiccups demurely

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: She hands it to him. O'Shea remembers it for a brief mome then lets it fall away. Lisa smiles. Proud of him.

dialogues.text: They stagger on, the beautiful sea panorama before them. Casually they fill the pauses, at ease with the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll take some time-off.

dialogues.text: Home of the Erin Island Grabbers. It's gonna get mental round here.
